meanings.sent1: She keeps mispronouncing the word 'library' as 'liberry'.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was mispronouncing the name of the restaurant all along.
meanings.sent3: The comedian had the audience in stitches by mispronouncing every word in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Mispronouncing words is like playing a wrong note in a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's demonstration on mispronouncing words left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.definition: To say a word or phrase incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: They were mispronouncing the foreign names during the language class.
meanings.sent2: I often catch myself mispronouncing 'entrepreneur' as 'entreprenuer'.
meanings.sent3: Mispronouncing the secret code led to a hilarious mix-up at the spy agency.
meanings.sent4: Her mispronouncing of the incantation caused the spell to backfire.
meanings.sent5: The news anchor's constant mispronouncing of names became a running joke among viewers.
